str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stretch out, tie up (for scourging), extend before. From pro and teino; to protend, i.e. Tie prostrate.
Perhaps from the same as hama; a strap, i.e. the tie or the lash.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A centurion of the Roman army. Or hekatontarchos hek-at-on'-tar-khos; from hekaton and archo; the captain of one hundred men.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To flog, scourge, whip. From mastos; to whip.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
Roman; subst: a Roman citizen. From Rhome; Romaean, i.e. Roman.
Uncondemned, not yet tried. Without trial.
